group_1.narration: At first, when Kaede stopped showing up, Rena just figured she@must've said something dumb again...and Kaede was just sulking.
Looking back now, I was way too carefree about it all.
Kaede had been dealing with everything by herself@for all that time, and Rena didn't even notice...!
Again and again, I kept thinking...if only I'd just been there@to carry the burden with her.
I started digging into some [textBlue:Rumor] with Iroha back then.@Mostly to take my mind off how worried I was about Kaede...
We ended up talking about the farthest edge of loneliness.
I thought it was just some urban legend, but then@Iroha started getting all these weird emails...
Some of them even sounded like@they knew Iroha was a Magical Girl.
So I guess that's when Iroha felt like@she had to investigate this [textBlue:Rumor].
I heard later that Iroha was going through a rough time@back then, too, no thanks to that [textBlue:Rumor]...
But Rena was so focused on Kaede that she barely@thought about what Iroha was going through.
Then, out of the blue, Momoko told me she needed to talk...@and had me meet her out in the rain.
I was annoyed at first, like, "What the heck are we doing in the rain?"@But when I saw Momoko's face...I couldn't say a word.
I'd never seen such a miserable expression@on Momoko's face before.
For some reason, I got the feeling that Momoko was about to tell me@something serious she'd been keeping close to her chest.
I felt relieved when I saw Kaede show up with her,@but that relief only lasted for a second.
Rena's bad feeling was spot-on...@Momoko told her the "truth".
Yeah... The so-called truth about Magical Girls.
I was in so much shock, I couldn't even feel angry or sad...@I just couldn't believe it.
But more than anything, what I didn't want to believe was that@Momoko and Kaede had been hiding this pain inside, all along.
Rena was the only one who didn't know.
That was the moment when Rena finally understood the feelings the@two of them had been carrying...and the truth about Magical Girls.
It might've already been too late, but I think the Rena@from back then still believed, somewhere deep down,@that knowing all this could change something.
But it still wasn't enough.@There were things I still didn't understand...
